actions.text: Committee on Rules ordered to be reported an original measure in lieu of S.Res. 12, S.Res. 15, S.Res. 25, S.Res. 26, S.Res. 28, S.Res. 29, S.Res. 30, S.Res. 32, S.Res. 33, S.Res. 34, S. Res. 35, S.Res. 41, S.Res. 50, S.Res. 51, S.Res. 52, S.Res. 54, S.Res. 57, S.Res. 58, S.Res. 60.
Committee on Rules. Original measure reported to Senate by Senator Ford. With written report No. 101-3.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 4.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.
Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

official_title: An original resolution authorizing biennial expenditures by committees of the Senate
short_title: Omnibus Committee Funding Resolution for 1989 and 1990

summary.text: Omnibus Committee Funding Resolution for 1989 and 1990 - Authorizes expenditures by the following Senate committees from March 1, 1989, through February 28, 1990, and for the period March 1, 1990, through February 28, 1991: (1) Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry; (2) Appropriations; (3) Armed Services; (4) Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs; (5) Budget; (6) Commerce, Science, and Transportation; (7) Energy and Natural Resources; (8) Environment and Public Works; (9) Finance; (10) Foreign Relations; (11) Governmental Affairs; (12) Judiciary; (13) Labor and Human Resources; (14) Rules and Administration; (15) Small Business; (16) Veterans' Affairs; (17) Aging; (18) Intelligence; and (19) Indian Affairs. Authorizes the transfer of any unexpended balance of any committee to a special reserve to assist such committee during the transition to a biennial budget. Repeals S. Res. 458, 100th Congress, which provided for managing the expenditure of funds for Senate official mail for FY 1989. Establishes a formula for determining the number of pieces of mail which may be mailed as franked mail by Senators.

titles.title: Omnibus Committee Funding Resolution for 1989 and 1990
An original resolution authorizing biennial expenditures by committees of the Senate
